question: Question 193 A centrifugal pump running at 500 rpm and at its maximum efficiency is delivering a head of 30 m at flow rate of 60 litres per minutes. If the rpm is changed to 1000, then the head H in meters and flow rate Q in litres per minute at maximum efficiency are estimated to be
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} &Condition-1 &Condition-2\\ N_{1}&=500 \mathrm{rpm} &N_{2}=100 \mathrm{rpm}\\ H_{1}&=30 \mathrm{m} &H_{2}=?\\ Q_{1}&=60 \text { litre/min } &Q_{2}=?\\ \end{aligned}[/latex] [latex] \begin{aligned} \text{Unit speed: }\quad N_{u}&=\frac{N}{\sqrt{H}} \\ \left(N_{u}\right)_{1}&=\left(N_{v}\right)_{2} \\ \frac{N_{1}}{\sqrt{H_{1}}}&=\frac{N_{2}}{\sqrt{H_{2}}} \\ \frac{500}{\sqrt{30}}&=\frac{1000}{\sqrt{H_{2}}} \\ \text{or}\quad \sqrt{H_{2}}&=\frac{1000}{500} \times \sqrt{30}=2 \times \sqrt{30}\\ \text{or }\quad H_{2}&=4 \times 30=120 \mathrm{m}\\ \text{Unit speed: }Q_{u}&=\frac{Q}{\sqrt{H}}\\ \left(Q_{u}\right)_{1}&=\left(Q_{u}\right)_{2} \\ \frac{N_{1}}{\sqrt{H_{1}}}&=\frac{N_{2}}{\sqrt{H_{2}}} \\ \frac{500}{\sqrt{30}}&=\frac{1000}{\sqrt{H_{2}}}\\ \text{or}\quad\sqrt{H_{2}}&=\frac{1000}{500} \times \sqrt{30}=2 \times \sqrt{30}\\ \text{or }\quad H_{2}&=4 \times 30=120 \mathrm{m} \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 194 Air flow through a venture and into atmosphere. Air density is a [latex]\rho[/latex]; atmospheric pressure is [latex]P_{a}[/latex]; throat  diameter is [latex]D_{t}[/latex]; exit diameter is D and exit velocity is U. The throat is connected to a cylinder containing a frictionless piston attached to a spring. The spring constant is k. The bottom surface of the piston is exposed to atmosphere. Due to the flow, the piston moves by distance x. Assuming incompressible frictionless flow, x is
solution: Applying continuity equation, we get [latex]\begin{aligned} A_1V_1&=A_2V_2\\ V_1&=\left ( \frac{A_2}{A_1} \right )V_2=\left ( \frac{\frac{\pi}{4}D^2}{\frac{\pi}{4}D_t^2} \right )U\\ V_1&=\left ( \frac{D}{D_t} \right )^2U\;\;...(i)\\ &\text{Applying Bernoulli's equation}\\ \frac{p_1}{\rho g}+\frac{V_1^2}{2g}&=\frac{p_2}{\rho g}+\frac{V_2^2}{2g}\\ [z_1=z_2 & \text{  because venturi is horizontal}]\\ \frac{p_1-p_2}{\rho g}&=\frac{V_2^2-V_1^2}{2g}\\ p_1-p_2&=\frac{\rho}{2}(V_2^2-V_1^2)\\ &\text{From Eq.(i), we get}\\ p_1-p_2&=\frac{\rho }{2}\left [ U^2-\left ( \frac{D}{D_t} \right )^4 U^2 \right ]\\ &=\frac{\rho }{2}U^2\left [ 1-\left ( \frac{D}{D_t} \right )^4 \right ]\;\;...(ii)\\ \text{Since, spring force}&= \text{ pressure force due to air}\\ -kx&=\frac{\pi}{4}D_s^2 \times (p_1-p_2)\\ &\text{From Eq. (ii), we get}\\ -kx&=\frac{\pi}{4}D_s^2 \times \frac{\rho U^2}{2}\left [ 1- \left ( \frac{D}{D_t} \right )^4\right ]\\ \therefore \;\;x&=\frac{\rho U^2}{8k}\left [ \left (\frac{D}{D_t} \right )^4-1 \right ] \pi D_s^2 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 195 A water container is kept on a weighing balance. Water from tap is falling vertically into the container with a volume flow rate of Q; the velocity of water when it hits the water surface is U. At a particular instant of the time the total mass of container and water is m. The force registered by the weighing balance at this instant of time is
solution: Mass of water striking per second [latex] =\rho Q [/latex] Force on weighing balance due to water striking = Initial momentum - Final momentum [latex] =\rho Q U-0 [/latex] [latex] =\rho Q U [/latex] Weight of container and water [latex] =m g [/latex] Now total force on weighing balance [latex] =m g+\rho Q U [/latex]

question: Question 196 A cylindrical body of cross -sectional area A, height H and density [latex]\rho _s[/latex], is immersed to depth h in a liquid of density [latex]\rho[/latex], and tied to the bottom with a string .The tension in the string is
solution: Let T = Tension in string acting in the downward direction Weight of body, [latex] W=M g(\downarrow) [/latex] [latex] =\rho_{\mathrm{s}} A H g [/latex] Buoyant force, [latex] \begin{aligned} F_{B} &=\rho g \forall(\uparrow) \\ &=\rho g A h \end{aligned} [/latex] For equilibrium, Weight of sphere + Tesnion in string [latex] w_{+T_{i}}[/latex] = Buoyant force or [latex]T=F_{B}-W [/latex] [latex] =\rho g A h-\rho_{s} A H g [/latex] [latex] =\left(\rho h-\rho_{s} H\right) g A[/latex]
